summary: This document is an email chain from June 12, 2020, regarding a fact-checking request from a journalist for the podcast 'Broken: Jeffrey Epstein'. The emails are between FBI personnel discussing whether to respond to inquiries about the FBI's involvement in the Epstein case, ultimately deciding on 'no comment' and redirecting the request to public affairs offices.

persons.name: IM Thoreson
persons.context: Mentioned as being added to the email chain to coordinate a response to a journalist's fact-checking request about the FBI's involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Fact-Checking Request for Epstein Podcast
events.description: A journalist sends a fact-checking request to the FBI regarding claims made in the podcast 'Broken: Jeffrey Epstein' about the FBI's involvement in the Epstein case. Internal FBI emails discuss and decide on a 'no comment' response.

keyFacts: In June 2020, a journalist was fact-checking a podcast titled 'Broken: Jeffrey Epstein' which explored the federal case against Epstein.
The podcast made several mentions of the FBI's involvement in the Epstein case, prompting the journalist to seek confirmation from the FBI.
Internal FBI correspondence shows a decision to respond with 'no comment' to the fact-checking inquiries.
The request was redirected from the Office of Public Affairs to the National Press Office and FBI NY Public Affairs (IM Thoreson) for coordination.
